page.title: 16BARNS IN THE COLN VALLEY.
page.content: Massive stone-built barns with a central opening and stone-slated roofs are a dominant feature of the Cotswolds. As their use for agricultural purposes wanes, many are being converted to other uses. That on Lower Farm in Coln Rogers is still used for drying grain, and the 14.Century Ablington Barn is also used for storage, beautifully kept and re-roofed some 20 years ago as the owner's "gift to posterity". Shoecroft Barn in Bibury is used for storage on the ground floor, with a flat for the manager of the Trout Farm above. Winson's Lower Barn and Corner Barn are used for refrigerated food storage, but Saltway Barn near Ablington was too dilapidated to be rescued, and its large supply of dressed stones and stone slates was used to build a house in Rendcomb.
